svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Coefficient of variation in caloric consumption vs. GDP per capita, 2014
The coefficient of variation in per capita caloric consumption of a given population versus gross domestic product
(GDP) per capita, measured in 2011 international-$. The coefficient variation (CV) measures the inequality of caloric
intake across a given population. It represents a statistical measure of the data spread around the mean caloric
intake. Higher CV values represent larger levels of dietary inequality.
Coefficient of variation in calorie consumption
Source: UN FAO (2017), Penn World Tables
